SENT.plain: Myelosarcoma (chloroma) is a rare primary condition in patients with either a myelodysplastic syndrome, or an acute or chronic leukemia
It is an extramedullary neoplasm which does not commonly present with changes in peripheral blood or bone marrow
The rarity and histomorphological similarity to malignant non-Hodgkin lymphoma renders the diagnosis notoriously difficult
Due to its coincidental or secondary manifestation followed by myelogenous leukemia, this tumor needs to be seen as a primary systemic disease
We present a 40 year old man with myelosarcoma of the jejunum and discuss this entity and its therapeutic options
